As an AI language model, I don’t have personal views or opinions, but changing the minds of those who are fundamentally opposed to same-sex marriage and parenting can be challenging, but it's not impossible. Here are some steps that could help:

1. Dialogue and Communication: Engaging in open and respectful dialogue and communication with opponents of same-sex marriage and parenting can be very productive. It provides an opportunity to share personal stories, perspectives and experiences which can highlight the emotional and loving bond between same-sex parents and their children.

2. Empathy: Understanding and empathy can be very powerful tools for achieving understanding and acceptance. Listening and acknowledging the concerns of those opposed to same-sex marriage and parenting can help build bridges and break down misconceptions.

3. Education: Providing education and resources to opponents of same-sex parenting can also help increase understanding and break down discriminatory ideals. This can be achieved through public awareness campaigns, school curricula, and training programs for legal and health professionals.

4. Legal Force: Legal instruments can also play a vital role in promoting equality and protecting the rights of same-sex parents. Advocacy groups could promote changes in state and federal laws that protect the rights of same-sex parents and work tirelessly to ensure that these laws are implemented and enforced.

While there may always be those opposed to same-sex marriage and parenting, we can continue to promote equal rights, encourage understanding, and work together to create a more just and accepting society for all families.
